description: From Middle English moderwort; equivalent to mother +â€Ž wort.

entries.meaning: Any of several perennial plants of the genus Leonurus, especially Leonurus cardiaca, used in traditional medicine to help with childbirth or treat uterine disorders. [from 13th c.]
examples: Besides, it makes women joyful and mothers of children and settles their wombs as they should be; therefore we call it Motherwort.
